Legal_Issue: Did the applicant meet the residency requirement under s. 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act?
Application_Facts: Applicant was physically present in Canada for 531 days during a six-year period, working abroad for a Canadian company.
Decision_Outcome: Appeal allowed; case referred back for new hearing
Remedy_Requested: New hearing to reassess residency establishment and maintenance
Court_Ruling: Unclear application of residency tests and insufficient analysis by Citizenship Judge
Defendant_Behavior: Extended absence from Canada, limited social ties
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to meet 1,095-day physical presence requirement
Legal_Standard: Physical presence in Canada for at least 1,095 days within six years
Assessment_Factor: Duration of physical presence, nature of absences, employment abroad, ties to Canada
Procedural_Issue: Insufficient reasoning and unclear application of legal standard by decision maker
Review_Standard: Standards of fact and law on appeal
Evidence_Used: Record of physical presence, employment documentation, evidence of ties to Canada
Application_Basis: Requirement to establish and maintain residency in Canada
Evidence_Assessed: Applicant's days of physical presence, work outside Canada, lack of social/familial ties
Relief_Sought: Allowance of appeal and referral for new hearing
Governing_Rule: Applicant must be physically present in Canada for at least 1,095 days in six years
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient analysis of residency tests and applicant’s circumstances
Harm_Assessment: Potential denial of citizenship due to non-compliance with residency rules
Cause_Description: Applicant's failure to meet residency days due to international work and lack of social ties
Evidence_Handling: Incomplete evaluation of applicant's residency indicators
Evidence_Issues: Lack of detailed assessment of absences and re-establishment of ties
Residency_Compliance: Not met (531 days out of required 1,095)
Evidence_Assessment: Inadequate consideration of facts related to residency
Decision_Rationale: Need for proper application of residency test and comprehensive analysis of applicant’s connection to Canada
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to adequately analyze applicant's residency behavior and supporting evidence
Legal_Standard_Applied: Objective assessment of physical presence and intent to reside in Canada
